intro: Coprosma vontempskyi, commonly known as the New Zealand coprosma, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its small, white or pinkish flowers are followed by bright red berries that attract birds. Coprosma vontempskyi plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
